descript.abstract: These data depict study areas (footprints) of wildlife surveys conducted in the Mid-Atlantic region since 2005. The study areas are comprised of aerial and shipboard surveys. These data are intended to be used as a working compendium to inform the diverse number of groups that conduct surveys in the Mid-Atlantic region.The study areas as depicted in this dataset have been derived from source tracklines and transects. The areas have been simplified due to the large size of the Mid-Atlantic region and the limited ability to map all areas simultaneously. The areas are to be used as a general reference and should not be considered definitive or authoritative.
descript.purpose: These study areas are survey area footprints that capture marine wildlife survey activity on the Atlantic Outer Continental Shelf (OCS). The only intended use is as a general overview of survey activity since 2005.

idinfo.useconst: These data are compiled as a general reference of recent (since 2005) survey activity that has occured on the Outer Continental Shelf (OCS). These data are representations of data obtained with the permission of the collecting entity, but these data are not authoritative. For authoritative data, contact the responsible entity as described in the attributes. These data are intended to be used for basic analysis and general planning efforts. Some of the data have specific use limitations, including the redistribution of the data. Obtain and carefully read the metadata from the authoritative data sources before use and distribution. The Bureau of Ocean Energy Management (BOEM) will not be held responsible for the misuse or mis-representation of these data.

dataqual.logic: A visual check of the dataset was performed, irrespective of topology or spatial accuracy.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The earliest year in which the survey was conducted.
The most recent year in which the survey was conducted.
The season in which the survey was conducted.

The target species surveyed.
These coded domain values include marine mammals, sea turtles, birds, a combination of two types, or all types.
The name of the survey or study.
The entity responsible for performing the survey, collecting the survey data, or maintaining the data.
The website where the survey report or information about the study can be located.
The website where the spatial data can be obtained.
Length of feature in internal units.
